protocol_name: CRISPR Editing of Human iPS cells with RNPs using Nucleofection
protocol_name_html: CRISPR Editing of Human iPS cells with RNPs using Nucleofection

materials.reagent_name: SF Cell Line 4D-Nucleofector® X Kit S (32 RCT)
Positive controls (Recommended: human RELA sgRNA, CDC42BPB sgRNA (Synthego))
Transfection controls (Recommended: pMAX GFP (Lonza), GFP mRNA (SBI))

warning: Please refer to the SDS (Safety Data Sheet) for safety warnings and hazard information.
keywords: Synthego, induced pluripotent stem cells, fibroblasts, ribonucleoprotein, iPSC, nucleofection
guidelines:
{"blocks":[{"key":"dmgfb","text":" Abbreviations:
  
CRISPR: clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats Cas9: CRISPR associated protein 9
sgRNA: single guide RNA
RNP: ribonucleoprotein
 PCR: polymerase chain reaction
ICE: inference of CRISPR edits
FACS: fluorescence-activated cell sorting TE: Tris EDTA
PBS: phosphate-buffered saline
GFP: green fluorescent protein
  
  Important Considerations
  
 Working with RNA and RNPs
  Wearing gloves and using nuclease-free tubes and reagents is recommended in order to avoid RNase contamination.
 Always maintain sterile technique, and use sterile, filter pipette tips.
 All Synthego and NucleofectorTM reagents should be stored according to the manufacturer’s recommendations.
 Synthetic sgRNA should be dissolved in TE buffer and diluted to a working concentration using nuclease-free water. Please consult the Synthego Quick Start Guide for best practices related to dissolving and storing synthetic sgRNAs.
 RNPs can be formed directly in NucleofectorTM solution.
 RNP complexes are stable at room temperature for up to 1 hour (may be stored at 4°C for up to one week, or at -20°C for up to 1 month). Note that RNPs stored at 4°C may become susceptible to contamination from microbial growth after long periods of time.
      
 Suggested Controls
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":1,"length":14,"style":"italic"},{"offset":381,"length":25,"style":"italic"},{"offset":352,"length":24,"style":"bold"},{"offset":1257,"length":18,"style":"bold"},{"offset":625,"length":2,"style":"sup"},{"offset":980,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":838,"length":26,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"1l9oj","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cb1fv","text":" 
    Timeline
  
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":6,"length":8,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5uvhd","text":"a","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":{}},{"key":"4psds","text":"
  
 Additional Information
  
 For an up-to-date list of all Synthego Protocols and other resources, please visit synthego.com/resources
  
 For technical assistance, contact our Scientific Support Team:
  
 Ph: 888.611.6883
 Email: support@synthego.com
 
 
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":5,"length":22,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":115,"length":22,"key":3},{"offset":234,"length":20,"key":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"m91i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://www.synthego.com/resources/sgrna-quick-start-guide"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"29976","guid":"321B83C0BC3611E8830403C9BE731D51","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/7i23g3e.png","placeholder":"","original_name":"Screen Shot 2018-09-18 at 6.28.32 PM.png","mime":"image/png","width":null,"height":null,"is_video":false}},"2":{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":null,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/5uqfw26.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/5uqfw26.png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2018-08-20 at 12.24.41 PM.png","width":"895","height":"411","mime":null,"is_video":false}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://www.synthego.com/resources"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"mailto:support@synthego.com"}}}}
status_info: This protocol was developed by researchers at Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich in conjunction with Synthego. It has been used by the developers, but has not been tested by Synthego.

steps.data:
{"blocks":[{"key":"7ouff","text":"Culture iPS cells on Matrigel® Matrix-coated plates until they are semiconfluent.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"87E025C90FE34E9E9349BCBC3DF012CF","id":656000,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Pre-Nucleofection - Seed Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52vc9","text":" Coat a new 6-well plate with Matrigel® Matrix and incubate according to the manufacturer’s instructions.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"AFD9614A9B7647B48747196E51E52B29","id":656001,"previous_id":656000,"previous_guid":"87E025C90FE34E9E9349BCBC3DF012CF","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Prepare Destination Plate"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51uja","text":" Aspirate Matrigel® Matrix from the plates after coating.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E7B533DC6B044540A043FCC9BC474835","id":656002,"previous_id":656001,"previous_guid":"AFD9614A9B7647B48747196E51E52B29","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Prepare Destination Plate"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23oh6","text":"Fill each well with 2 ml mTeSR1 medium + 10 μM ROCK inhibitor. 
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3lbh","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9120","amount":"2","unit":"2","label":"mTeSR1 medium + 10 μM ROCK inhibitor","guid":"5205431E667D4E4DBE3E37F0254A9B6B"}}],"guid":"F5272DC6E6FC45A4B2C069DF4FA11AE7","id":656003,"previous_id":656002,"previous_guid":"E7B533DC6B044540A043FCC9BC474835","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Prepare Destination Plate"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"19dv6","text":"Incubate at 37\u00b0C until nucleofection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"178u2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"3016","temperature":"37","unit":"10","label":"Incubation","guid":"F26EA2C5D08446BEA0E2FF9FACAC550A"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2desr","text":"Prepare 70 μl additional pre-warmed mTeSR1 medium + 10 μM ROCK per reaction for cell recovery after nucleofection.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4km1f","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9121","amount":"70","unit":"1","label":"mTeSR1 medium + 10 μM ROCK","guid":"EA57E967E9B5458FB22CA52E4FC5F373"}}],"guid":"7C9B00DA91F04CE2BDDEBE49D8C1D6D9","id":656005,"previous_id":656004,"previous_guid":"45F7968F0B714041B42A8F8983D97309","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Prepare Destination Plate"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1b9a","text":"Make sure that the entire NucleofectorTM Supplement is added to the NucleofectorTM Solution (according to manufacturer's protocol) and that the mixture is not more than 3 months old.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":38,"length":2,"style":"sup"},{"offset":80,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"5084972C5217496F8E77450570FC0AE4","id":656006,"previous_id":656005,"previous_guid":"7C9B00DA91F04CE2BDDEBE49D8C1D6D9","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Prepare Destination Plate"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2qs5f","text":"Hydrate sgRNA (3 nmol) in 30 μl 1X nuclease-free TE buffer to make 100 μM (100 pmol/μl) sgRNA. Concentration of Cas9 nuclease: 20 μM (20 pmol/μl).
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1vqnv","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9122","amount":"30","unit":"1","label":"1X nuclease-free TE buffer","guid":"BD3A29DF95B44A1BB35751570EE3391C"}}],"guid":"604F9BCC25F4456D9B6014A81DD0881E","id":656007,"previous_id":656006,"previous_guid":"5084972C5217496F8E77450570FC0AE4","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Assemble RNP complexes (7.5:1 sgRNA to Cas9 ratio)"}
steps.section: Setup & Nucleofection -  Assemble RNP complexes (7.5:1 sgRNA to Cas9 ratio)

steps.data:
{"blocks":[{"key":"b3c3u","text":"Incubate the RNPs at room temperature for 10 minutes, then place on ice until use.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9gpji","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"18391","duration":"600","label":"Incubation","guid":"5DE7F2808E45423BB54778E95EEA7244"}}],"guid":"9397636FF4984C5481FFDB8F4BDBAD3B","id":656009,"previous_id":656008,"previous_guid":"B40834C3DBDC4CB39726AC551509286E","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Assemble RNP complexes (7.5:1 sgRNA to Cas9 ratio)"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2b17g","text":"Prior to electroporation, detach the iPS cells from the Matrigel® Matrix plates by incubating with pre-warmed Accutase® for 3-5 minutes at 37°C.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"crlq9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"eq6q2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"3017","temperature":"37","unit":"10","label":"Incubation","guid":"BF952B2C44F04838941B789CCEE2D33C"}},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"18392","duration":"180","label":"Incubation","guid":"A3928330181C4F00A0A44D49105B18E3"}}],"guid":"1591245D483649F9A94C0AED374ED59E","id":656010,"previous_id":656009,"previous_guid":"9397636FF4984C5481FFDB8F4BDBAD3B","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8t8jd","text":" Dissociate the cells into a single cell suspension by pipetting the suspension carefully up and down 4-6 times.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"DCCD85601E9C41BD9810D60A918D1E06","id":656011,"previous_id":656010,"previous_guid":"1591245D483649F9A94C0AED374ED59E","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6619q","text":"   Add the same amount of mTeSR1 medium to stop Accutase®.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cusqs","text":"Harvest the cells to an appropriately sized tube.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"5AFA772A6B5948E697B057C33BC15B5D","id":656013,"previous_id":656012,"previous_guid":"FC4C7A9201604DECA9A175A21F80F4D2","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0u0t","text":"Count an aliquot of the detached cells and determine cell density.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6E7EB048F06B4A7082E1590DE999F221","id":656014,"previous_id":656013,"previous_guid":"5AFA772A6B5948E697B057C33BC15B5D","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3m1r9","text":"Transfer the required number of cells (5 x 105 cells per reaction) to a Corning® 15 ml Centrifuge Tube.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":45,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D844C6E7B39249D38D70FA36D00D85F1","id":656015,"previous_id":656014,"previous_guid":"6E7EB048F06B4A7082E1590DE999F221","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jsp9","text":"Centrifuge cells at 115 x g for 3 minutes at room temperature.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eddtt","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"18393","duration":"180","label":"Centrifugation","guid":"CA6801D0314446D0A6B82EA1EB89E02F"}}],"guid":"57BCC74549FA43D5BF0795D5823B92A2","id":656016,"previous_id":656015,"previous_guid":"D844C6E7B39249D38D70FA36D00D85F1","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5910v","text":"Aspirate the supernatant completely. The cell pellets will not be packed tightly so care is required when removing supernatant.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"CD43FB73949F4DFBA64B77E9FABA55F8","id":656017,"previous_id":656016,"previous_guid":"57BCC74549FA43D5BF0795D5823B92A2","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f2sko","text":"Add 5 ml of PBS buffer and wash cells by gently pipetting up and down.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dvl1k","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9125","amount":"5","unit":"2","label":"PBS buffer","guid":"121502595CF5402B90E67BFD6D2E8A31"}}],"guid":"B8F3F4DCB57C4DD1B3451B0332946CDB","id":656018,"previous_id":656017,"previous_guid":"CD43FB73949F4DFBA64B77E9FABA55F8","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"435lg","text":"Centrifuge at 115 x g for 3 minutes at room temperature. 
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c3h3a","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"18394","duration":"180","label":"Centrifugation","guid":"8D33648F04964018A9F8B8DCA7CC05D3"}}],"guid":"F62D3218772D4ECBA51C26FB7431A528","id":656019,"previous_id":656018,"previous_guid":"B8F3F4DCB57C4DD1B3451B0332946CDB","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ae4","text":"Aspirate the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"19CFAB7172764010A1D5FAFCA635AA6E","id":656020,"previous_id":656019,"previous_guid":"F62D3218772D4ECBA51C26FB7431A528","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fmdv6","text":"Resuspend cells in Lonza P3 NucleofectorTM solution at 20 μl/reaction. Work quickly, but carefully, and avoid leaving cells in the NucleofectorTM solution for longer than 15 minutes. Avoid bubble formation.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":40,"length":2,"style":"sup"},{"offset":143,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"CC7C5AB1BA1A429FB736E8E7688D1CA6","id":656021,"previous_id":656020,"previous_guid":"19CFAB7172764010A1D5FAFCA635AA6E","section":"Setup & Nucleofection -  Prepare Cell Suspension"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3he5","text":"   Mix 20 μl of cells with 5 μl RNPs (prepared in Step 8) for each reaction in an appropriate tube/plate.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f0did","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"1vrs6","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9126","amount":"20","unit":"1","label":"cells","guid":"C84CD870B7D74B1CADA20FB7C5FBBC02"}},{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9127","amount":"5","unit":"1","label":"RNPs","guid":"53507C3398754F9787248C4CB25AD6C5"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cul2c","text":"Transfer each cell-RNP solution (25 μl) to each well of the NucleocuvetteTM strip. Click the lid into place.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":73,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A73EC850A02F402CA3A10E1135CB8EEA","id":656023,"previous_id":656022,"previous_guid":"21D81CB6B7FA455FBDBA704CBBA18A67","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Transfer Cell/RNP Suspension to the Nucleocuvette Strip"}
steps.section: Setup & Nucleofection - Transfer Cell/RNP Suspension to the Nucleocuvette Strip

steps.data:
{"blocks":[{"key":"7r21a","text":"Gently tap the NucleocuvetteTM strip on the benchtop to make sure the sample covers the bottom of the cuvette and that there are no bubbles in the wells.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":28,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"71A1A963777B4130BB12C3845822BF19","id":656024,"previous_id":656023,"previous_guid":"A73EC850A02F402CA3A10E1135CB8EEA","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Transfer Cell/RNP Suspension to the Nucleocuvette Strip"}
steps.section: Setup & Nucleofection - Transfer Cell/RNP Suspension to the Nucleocuvette Strip

steps.data:
{"blocks":[{"key":"7rk7u","text":"Place the NucleocuvetteTM strip with closed lid into the retainer of the 4D-X Core unit. Check for proper orientation of the NucleocuvetteTM strip. Larger cutout is the top (A1 and A2) and smaller cutout is the bottom (H1 and H2).
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":23,"length":2,"style":"sup"},{"offset":138,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"63604634E6C74554B5AF6F4D96ED10D6","id":656025,"previous_id":656024,"previous_guid":"71A1A963777B4130BB12C3845822BF19","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Transfect Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0haj","text":"Use the electroporation protocol “CA137.” Press “Start” on the display of the core unit. After run completion, the screen should display a green “+” over the wells that were successfully transfected. Remove the NucleocuvetteTM strip from the core unit.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"512E8C3D0D554243A69A8ABD071FA64F","id":656026,"previous_id":656025,"previous_guid":"63604634E6C74554B5AF6F4D96ED10D6","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Transfect Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33m4u","text":"Use a multichannel pipette to add 70 μl pre-warmed mTeSR1 medium + 10 μM ROCK into each well of the NucleocuvetteTM strip to recover the cells.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":113,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"rdrg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"9128","amount":"70","unit":"1","label":"pre-warmed mTeSR1 medium + 10 μM ROCK","guid":"14E38FB6B09D4890919902943CB59D3F"}}],"guid":"60E14AF046294704889CEFD90C3280D8","id":656027,"previous_id":656026,"previous_guid":"512E8C3D0D554243A69A8ABD071FA64F","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Add Recovery Medium"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fbc8a","text":"Transfer cells from each well to the pre-warmed 6-well plate (prepared in Step 2) and incubate overnight in a humidified 37°C/5% CO2 incubator.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":131,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1stbu","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"3018","temperature":"37","unit":"10","label":"5% CO2 incubator","guid":"B2FFDD3A82004DFFB800C07359DCC7A1"}}],"guid":"7A66079B5EBA4F94959EEAEDC2E008EA","id":656028,"previous_id":656027,"previous_guid":"60E14AF046294704889CEFD90C3280D8","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Plate Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8r7a7","text":"Change with fresh mTeSR1 (without ROCK inhibitor) 24 hours after nucleofection and daily until time for cell harvest.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7fssg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"18395","duration":"86400","label":"","guid":"8E11486DC8A44E578ADBE6176DF8D0B1"}}],"guid":"29F30FF9E7AD4010B2A8FADD4E909EBD","id":656029,"previous_id":656028,"previous_guid":"7A66079B5EBA4F94959EEAEDC2E008EA","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Plate Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"41tll","text":"Incubate the cells for 4 days in a humidified 37°C/5% CO2 incubator.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":56,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dqvbd","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"e1tk2","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"3019","temperature":"37","unit":"10","label":"5% CO2 incubator","guid":"24EE5D1BB5514A24BFE0BAF1B26B6C93"}},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"18396","duration":"345600","label":"5% CO2 incubator","guid":"1BAFC2303A1342C08A07BB1C9CBAFA3E"}}],"guid":"49CBFAD4A2CF40F884D4DCB6FF889BC6","id":656030,"previous_id":656029,"previous_guid":"29F30FF9E7AD4010B2A8FADD4E909EBD","section":"Setup & Nucleofection - Plate Cells"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"osgh","text":"Conduct analyses to determine editing efficiency: PCR, Sanger sequencing, and ICE analysis. Next-Gen Sequencing, FACS, or functional tests may be conducted as alternatives. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":78,"length":12,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"bdfko","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://ice.synthego.com/#/"}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"

Option: If storing cells for future use is desired, split cells into two groups (one for analysis and one for cell culture).

"}],"guid":"A9BA2B363ED94E6794A0653E74DF6773","id":656031,"previous_id":665917,"previous_guid":"CE341B10BC3511E8830403C9BE731D51","section":"Post-Nucleofection - Analysis"}
